revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-15 07:42:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/wsgi_service.py'], 'message': "Raise KeyboardInterrupt on SIGTERM - Workaround

Catch SIGTERM signal and call the signal handler method.
The signal handler then raises KeyboardInterrupt. The
KeyboardInterrupt won't be caught by any 'except Exception'
clauses.

Without this the service does not stop periodic workers,
tear down pxe filters etc as it is supposed to on shutdown.

NOTE: Calling shutdown() directly from the signal handler
causes the below error. This is why the signal handler
raises KeyboardInterrupt.

This patch differs from the commit on master in that it
also imports 'signal' module. In master the signal module
was already imported.

Related-Bug: #1765700

Story: 2001890
Task: 14374
Change-Id: If0e24eae767b7806243fa4ae34fedb30ae9af25a
(cherry picked from commit 737dbeae118cc136597565c8c1449fca4945143c)
"}]
commit_message:
Raise KeyboardInterrupt on SIGTERM - Workaround

Catch SIGTERM signal and call the signal handler method.
The signal handler then raises KeyboardInterrupt. The
KeyboardInterrupt won't be caught by any 'except Exception'
clauses.

Without this the service does not stop periodic workers,
tear down pxe filters etc as it is supposed to on shutdown.

NOTE: Calling shutdown() directly from the signal handler
causes the below error. This is why the signal handler
raises KeyboardInterrupt.
 AssertionError: Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP

This patch differs from the commit on master in that it
also imports 'signal' module. In master the signal module
was already imported.

Related-Bug: #1765700

Story: 2001890
Task: 14374
Change-Id: If0e24eae767b7806243fa4ae34fedb30ae9af25a
(cherry picked from commit 737dbeae118cc136597565c8c1449fca4945143c)

Add debug log messages describing why we're excluding allocation
requests from GET /allocation_candidates for the following scenarios:

- When used + amount exceeds capacity (this usually happens because
  we combine more than one AllocationRequestResource).
- When amount exceeds max_unit (ditto).
- When group_policy=isolate and the allocation request has more than one
  AllocationRequestResource from the same resource provider for
  different request groups.

Change-Id: Id9ce14e3bb5df24cbbd0d6a1015fa9829f4467c2
"}]
commit_message:
Debug logs for allocation_candidates filters

Add debug log messages describing why we're excluding allocation
requests from GET /allocation_candidates for the following scenarios:

- When used + amount exceeds capacity (this usually happens because
  we combine more than one AllocationRequestResource).
- When amount exceeds max_unit (ditto).
- When group_policy=isolate and the allocation request has more than one
  AllocationRequestResource from the same resource provider for
  different request groups.

Change-Id: Id9ce14e3bb5df24cbbd0d6a1015fa9829f4467c2

commit_message:
Align tests with how functional tests are handled

- move tests directory under kolla_cli
- create new functional directory and put all tests in there
- add empty unit test directory
- add "test_" as a prefix to all test files (so ostestr sees them)
- use ostestr (--serial) to run the tests
- add functional tests into tox and zuul configs
- update tests/common to rip out code that selected which cli
command to use. will now always use python kolla_cli/shell.py

No test files were modified.

Change-Id: Iec80f7546b0f4ff2a857b14f546fd299732c727d
Implements: blueprint initial-testing

with [0] and only available in oslo.concurrency 3.26.0 or newer.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-08 09:05:27.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/maintenance.py'], 'message': 'Lower log level for the maintenance thread

Prior to this patch the maintenance thread was logging an warning when
any inconsistencies were found between the Neutron and OVN database
without any message saying that it's going to be fixed automatically.
That caused confusion between users.

This patch is changing the message to be less "scary" and lowering it's
log level as well because the inconsistencies are going to be fixed
without the need of any manual interaction from the administrator.

DEBUG was choosen over INFO for the message because usually INFO is
choosen to indicate that something has been completed already instead
of some on-going operation. That said, we are already logging an INFO
message at the end of the synchronization to inform that it has been
completed and how long it took.

Change-Id: I520f3f1f6bd61c2ec8d8ed29260c7ebec8f0184f
'}]
commit_message:
Lower log level for the maintenance thread

Prior to this patch the maintenance thread was logging an warning when
any inconsistencies were found between the Neutron and OVN database
without any message saying that it's going to be fixed automatically.
That caused confusion between users.

This patch is changing the message to be less "scary" and lowering it's
log level as well because the inconsistencies are going to be fixed
without the need of any manual interaction from the administrator.

DEBUG was choosen over INFO for the message because usually INFO is
choosen to indicate that something has been completed already instead
of some on-going operation. That said, we are already logging an INFO
message at the end of the synchronization to inform that it has been
completed and how long it took.

Change-Id: I520f3f1f6bd61c2ec8d8ed29260c7ebec8f0184f

subject: Fix logging of encoded headers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-05-15 14:29:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1766235wq-0de60d0f996c6bfb.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix logging of encoded headers

A change introduced in 3.5.0 sorts headers, but runs into a problem
when the headers are bytes, such as the headers provided by the
python-glanceclient.

requests expects headers to be str type in both python2 and python3.
This means in python2 we need to encode unicode objects as ASCII (the
encoding that should be used for HTTP headers) and in python3 we need to
decode bytes as ASCII into str.

Change-Id: Ib81497c3a873616c22ba68256c596a6fb113e11e
Closes-bug: #1766235
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logging of encoded headers

A change introduced in 3.5.0 sorts headers, but runs into a problem
when the headers are bytes, such as the headers provided by the
python-glanceclient.

requests expects headers to be str type in both python2 and python3.
This means in python2 we need to encode unicode objects as ASCII (the
encoding that should be used for HTTP headers) and in python3 we need to
decode bytes as ASCII into str.

Change-Id: Ib81497c3a873616c22ba68256c596a6fb113e11e
Closes-bug: #1766235

subject: Check cirros symlink before creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-15 20:54:16.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': "Check cirros symlink before creation

Currently, run_tests.sh does:
ln -s ~/cache/files/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img $IMG_DIR

inconditionally. This patch checks if the file exists and is a symlink
before doing the ln -s.

This helps running ./all-in-one.sh twice if the first attempt failed, for
some reasons, which isn't hypothetical, it happens often that it fails
because of networking problems (bad WIFI) on my laptop.

Change-Id: I3faed512a1eeccef15f4965d6deb2151eab9d36d
"}]
commit_message:
Check cirros symlink before creation

Currently, run_tests.sh does:
ln -s ~/cache/files/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img $IMG_DIR

inconditionally. This patch checks if the file exists and is a symlink
before doing the ln -s.

This helps running ./all-in-one.sh twice if the first attempt failed, for
some reasons, which isn't hypothetical, it happens often that it fails
because of networking problems (bad WIFI) on my laptop.

Change-Id: I3faed512a1eeccef15f4965d6deb2151eab9d36d

subject: [rabbitmq] Implement active call monitoring
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-05-09 17:08:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/test_transport.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/rpc/test_client.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/base.py', 'oslo_messaging/transport.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/test_functional.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_amqp1.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py'], 'message': '[rabbitmq] Implement active call monitoring

This adds an optional call_monitor_timeout parameter to the RPC client,
which if specified, will enable heartbeating of long-running calls by
the server. This enables the user to increase the regular timeout to
a much larger value, allowing calls to take a very long time, but
with heartbeating to indicate that they are still running on the server
side. If the server stops heartbeating, then the call_monitor_timeout
takes over and we fail with the usual MessagingTimeout instead of waiting
for the longer overall timeout to expire.

Change-Id: I60334aaf019f177a984583528b71d00859d31f84
'}]
commit_message:
[rabbitmq] Implement active call monitoring

This adds an optional call_monitor_timeout parameter to the RPC client,
which if specified, will enable heartbeating of long-running calls by
the server. This enables the user to increase the regular timeout to
a much larger value, allowing calls to take a very long time, but
with heartbeating to indicate that they are still running on the server
side. If the server stops heartbeating, then the call_monitor_timeout
takes over and we fail with the usual MessagingTimeout instead of waiting
for the longer overall timeout to expire.

Change-Id: I60334aaf019f177a984583528b71d00859d31f84

commit_message:
Update PCI passthrough template for >= Pike

The [pci] header is necessary since pike [0]. This change updates the
pike template to add the [pci] header, rename pci_passthrough_whitelist
to passthrough_whitelist and add the config option pci-alias.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/pci-passthrough.html

Change-Id: I7a8c76f5989edb5b4a0b30036ce722ffb0ecb7ab

subject: Ensure neutron-server works after starting
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2018-05-16 14:57:21.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/server.pp'], 'message': "Ensure neutron-server works after starting

In Debian, running neutron net-list after starting neutron-server fails
because it takes too much time for neutron-server to be up. Even using
Type=notify in the .service unit doesn't help.

So this patch uses openstacklib::service_validation to run
openstack network list after the server is started, to make sure
it works.

Depends-On: If10b57a38c61cadca48e1e3c1e76d659397849fb
Needed-By: I093b0de94e3f762edb9be71134078d86b0642a07
Change-Id: I8ab8a2c7bb1d93d6fb9d16eabd3a1112b1e1237b
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure neutron-server works after starting

In Debian, running neutron net-list after starting neutron-server fails
because it takes too much time for neutron-server to be up. Even using
Type=notify in the .service unit doesn't help.

So this patch uses openstacklib::service_validation to run
openstack network list after the server is started, to make sure
it works.

Depends-On: If10b57a38c61cadca48e1e3c1e76d659397849fb
Needed-By: I093b0de94e3f762edb9be71134078d86b0642a07
Change-Id: I8ab8a2c7bb1d93d6fb9d16eabd3a1112b1e1237b

commit_message:
Run containers update only for required packages

Run containers update only for packages which were built and their
dependencies. Don't run container update at all if nothing was
built in the patch.

Depends on https://github.com/imain/container-check/pull/2 to pass
Change-Id: I764bc9a368e63a9aa82ec5503bcd3a9c7c6f4e25

commit_message:
FFU Set NetworkDeploymentActions CREATE,UPDATE for ffwd-upgrade prepare

And unset back to CREATE on ffwd-upgrade converge. See [0] for more
discussion. This is to allow operators to update to the new script
based os-net-config network templates during the ffwd-upgrade.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1568561#c3
Change-Id: Ib5be49579545ad0ec7bf95e96fbe1f62ec4d3ac0

Airship is a collection of components that provide a declarative
interface for deploying a bare metal Kubernetes cluster at scale to
facilitate integrated deployment of OpenStack on Kubernetes using the
existing OpenStack-Helm project [1].

Diving Bell is a lightweight host configuration management tool.  It
fits in the Airship ecosystem in areas where leveraging containers for
configuration management is not ideal.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm

Change-Id: I7728db62cfa2400808307958fc9e7e061ae2a04d
'}]
commit_message:
New Airship project - Diving Bell

Airship is a collection of components that provide a declarative
interface for deploying a bare metal Kubernetes cluster at scale to
facilitate integrated deployment of OpenStack on Kubernetes using the
existing OpenStack-Helm project [1].

Diving Bell is a lightweight host configuration management tool.  It
fits in the Airship ecosystem in areas where leveraging containers for
configuration management is not ideal.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm

Change-Id: I7728db62cfa2400808307958fc9e7e061ae2a04d

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* Bump cinder from 12.0.0 to 12.0.1
* Bump glance from 16.0.0 to 16.0.1
* Bump heat from 10.0.0 to 10.0.1
* Bump horizon from 13.0.0 to 13.0.1
* Bump manila from 6.0.0 to 6.0.1
* Bump mistral from 6.0.1 to 6.0.2
* Bump networking-ovn from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1
* Bump neutron-dynamic-routing from 12.0.0 to 12.0.1
* Bump neutron from 12.0.1 to 12.0.2
* Bump nova from 17.0.2 to 17.0.3
* Bump panko from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1
* Bump zaqar from 6.0.0 to 6.0.1
* Bump zaqar-ui from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1

Change-Id: Ica8b88dba62635367ed1abeb57fee91ed0271cb5

subject: Remove install-requirements script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-15 08:33:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/install-requirements'], 'message': 'Remove install-requirements script

this script is not used anywhere anymore, and it will not work
with recent pip 10.x release due to changes in the pip API.

Initially this script was meant to install only a limited set of requirements
to run heat_integrationtests without having to install whole Heat.

Since the split of heat_tempest_plugin the tests left in the
heat_integrationtests are meant to be run only in a DevStack-like env,
so all the requirements are already available.

Change-Id: I94c82fe100dfb6557cc960ef1198f1195780f28f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove install-requirements script

this script is not used anywhere anymore, and it will not work
with recent pip 10.x release due to changes in the pip API.

Initially this script was meant to install only a limited set of requirements
to run heat_integrationtests without having to install whole Heat.

Since the split of heat_tempest_plugin the tests left in the
heat_integrationtests are meant to be run only in a DevStack-like env,
so all the requirements are already available.

Change-Id: I94c82fe100dfb6557cc960ef1198f1195780f28f

commit_message:
Correct error handling in early deployment state

First, after move to openstacksdk get_image_info/get_network raise
an exception instead of returning None. Second, we need to clean up
reservation and ports when it happens.

Change-Id: Iecb97aaf41d226efeb8163ac6cd20ade101a742f

commit_message:
Delete sandbox on capsule delete

We need to delete the sandbox for cleaning up the networking
resources. Otherwise, the neutron ports of the capsule won't
be cleaned up.

Closes-Bug: #1762895
Change-Id: I798d32d04b679b4c3cfb48adbc21dade102b8ce3

commit_message:
Revert "Create floating ip by normal user"

I think these initial load balancer patches went in the wrong direction and are not aligned to the modern tempest documentation/path. I think we need to restore Jude's work.

This reverts commit bf966a9b2553adc6a74b0b3c99acb243f3676201.

Change-Id: I28c9723d55875542a38c115d03f3d1555406209d

commit_message:
Switch public endpoints to use FQDNs by default

This is in preparation for TLS by default, since the TLS certificate will
use FQDNs for the SubjectAltName, and that will be verified.
This required for us to change both CloudDomain and CloudName to be
required parameters, and not default them to use localdomain. This is to
avoid folks in real deployments using them in their clouds.

Change-Id: Ic70dd323b33596eaa3fc18bdc69a7c011ccd7fa1

commit_message:
quota: Merge tenant_limit_usages into tenant_quota_usages

The response of tenant_quota_usages is now baesd on the limit API,
so tenant_limit_usages and tenant_quota_usages provide same information.
This commit changes all consumers of tenant_limit_usages to use
tenant_quota_usages and updates the corresponding templates.

blueprint make-quotas-great-again
Change-Id: I620e2946f2aca31bac134c247ceaf971498f9eeb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-24 20:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/external-dev.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/service-catalog.rst'], 'message': 'Add conceptual overview of the service catalog

During the Liberty summit in Vancouver, there was a session on

As a result, Dolph put together a really good post condensing that

This commit massages some of the wording and proposes the guide as a

commit_message:
Add conceptual overview of the service catalog

During the Liberty summit in Vancouver, there was a session on
the standardization of the service catalog:

  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/service-catalog-cross-project-vancouver

As a result, Dolph put together a really good post condensing that
information for client developers as well as developers working
on integrating their services into the OpenStack ecosystem:

  https://blog.dolphm.com/openstack-keystone-service-catalog/

This commit massages some of the wording and proposes the guide as a
section of our own contributor documentation.

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie3328a8f7e093e894903a48809761fcbad279154
Closes-Bug: 1459402

subject: Read in ca certificate as binary for PY3
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-05-15 14:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['charmhelpers/contrib/hahelpers/apache.py'], 'message': 'Read in ca certificate as binary for PY3

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services. The writing of the file was changed to bytes
in https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/58/.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I64eb2b90776bb1e37de009208f016f176bd6a82a
Closes-Bug: #1762431
'}]
commit_message:
Read in ca certificate as binary for PY3

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services. The writing of the file was changed to bytes
in https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/58/.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I64eb2b90776bb1e37de009208f016f176bd6a82a
Closes-Bug: #1762431

Some VMs may require to have the cpu_mode set to specific value:

commit_message:
Add LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE configuration option

Some VMs may require to have the cpu_mode set to specific value:
- host, host-passthrough, ...
This patch adds the configuration option "LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE" to
be able to set the cpu_mode for nova/libvirt.
The default behavior ('cpu_mode=none') is not modified.

Change-Id: Id1ce9a308c51d0268a3d267d1eeedde63b8b6b71
Signed-off-by: Christophe Fontaine <christophe.fontaine@qosmos.com>

commit_message:
KeystoneAuth should default to system CAFile.

When SSL Verfication is enabled (by default),
not specifying a default CABundle causes unexpected
SSL verification failures.

Change-Id: I62e5d58d5635b4541c8b65f83003c68f0b55c750
Closes-Bug: #1678686

commit_message:
Support DNS lookup for generic plugins

If no auth_url is provided to the generic plugins then the plugin should
be able to determine the root keystone URL from DNS and use that as its
entrypoint.

Implements: bp dns-discovery
Change-Id: Ia1ee07710d955d949909313ed51643f34097dbf7

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-01-07 21:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/extras/saml2/test_auth_adfs.py', 'keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/saml2.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.cfg', 'keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/adfs.py', 'tox.ini', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/extras/saml2/test_auth_saml2.py'], 'message': "Switch saml2 from lxml to built-in xml

The saml2 code didn't use any xpath that couldn't be worked around
pretty easily. Without the extra lxml requirement, this code doesn't
need to be optional.

Another difference is namespace support. While built-in XML allows
the application to register namespaces, it's done globally, which
would not be a friendly thing for a library to do. As such, the
namespacing is left up to the xml library.

The tests continue to use lxml as much as possible for now to show
that they're compatible.

Change-Id: I0716641f8fb28e8dbc261e3af91857b9c8e52b23
"}]
commit_message:
Switch saml2 from lxml to built-in xml

The saml2 code didn't use any xpath that couldn't be worked around
pretty easily. Without the extra lxml requirement, this code doesn't
need to be optional.

Another difference is namespace support. While built-in XML allows
the application to register namespaces, it's done globally, which
would not be a friendly thing for a library to do. As such, the
namespacing is left up to the xml library.

The tests continue to use lxml as much as possible for now to show
that they're compatible.

Change-Id: I0716641f8fb28e8dbc261e3af91857b9c8e52b23

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix missed kolla_action and kolla_serial

In change I78cb60168aaa40bb6439198283546b7faf33917c, action was changed
to kolla_action, and serial to kolla_serial, to avoid Ansible warnings
due to use of reserved keywords. In that change, some keywords were
missed, and some changes that were merged since then have not switched
to the new variables. This change fixes all current instances of those
issues.

Change-Id: I357dffdfcb2b405e280a962d366ee65eebf0a8d1
Implements: blueprint migrate-to-ansible-2-2-0

subject: Use "passive_deletes=True" in ORM relationships
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-16 08:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_subworkflows.py', 'mistral/cmd/launch.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Use "passive_deletes=True" in ORM relationships

* Using "passive_deletes=True" when configuring relationships
  with SQLAlchemy significantly reduces memory footprint when
  deleting a graph of objects (e.g. root workflow execution
  with all dependent tasks, actions and sub workflows) from DB.
  This happens because in this case SQLAlchemy doesn't load
  those dependent objects that are not yet in the session and
  rather relies on cascading mechanisms of databases which are
  activated by the proper configuration of foreign key columns.
  For example, "ON DELETE CASCADE" clause in the foreign key
  definition in case of for MySQL.
  Particularly, this change reduces memory footprint of API
  processes when deleting large graphs of executions and
  execution expiration policy mechanism where the same happens
  but on the engine side.
* Added a test to make sure that cascaded deletion works well
  with this new property.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I36988817fb8e7695094ef98958b8aa151208fadb
'}]
commit_message:
Use "passive_deletes=True" in ORM relationships

* Using "passive_deletes=True" when configuring relationships
  with SQLAlchemy significantly reduces memory footprint when
  deleting a graph of objects (e.g. root workflow execution
  with all dependent tasks, actions and sub workflows) from DB.
  This happens because in this case SQLAlchemy doesn't load
  those dependent objects that are not yet in the session and
  rather relies on cascading mechanisms of databases which are
  activated by the proper configuration of foreign key columns.
  For example, "ON DELETE CASCADE" clause in the foreign key
  definition in case of for MySQL.
  Particularly, this change reduces memory footprint of API
  processes when deleting large graphs of executions and
  execution expiration policy mechanism where the same happens
  but on the engine side.
* Added a test to make sure that cascaded deletion works well
  with this new property.

Related-Bug: #1757966
Change-Id: I36988817fb8e7695094ef98958b8aa151208fadb

commit_message:
Enable config-download deployment tracking

With introduction of config-download the deployment process is split
into 2 parts and it can no more be tracked by tracking Heat stack
creation. Deployment status is now stored in Swift object and is
updated by Mistral workflows. This allows clients to easily retrieve
the current deployment status at any point of time.

This change brings necessary changes to accomodate new deployment
status/progress tracking

* Disable all fetching related to heat stack from CurrentPlan
  and replace it with deployment status from swift
* Update DeployStep and DeploymentDetail to render Deployment status
  components by deploymentStatus
* Separate DeploymentConfirmation and DeploymentDetail into different
  routes
* Remove deployment actions from PlansActions and use
  DeploymentActions
* Update deployment status/progress by responding to Zaqar messages
  sent during the process
* Update deployment status components to use deploymentStatus rather
  than stack status
* Remove Heat stack polling to get deployment status

Implements: blueprint config-download-ui
Change-Id: Ifd0f2a73310e53102a31991103aa8d0eeed203d5

commit_message:
Add ability to control Glance's enabled_import_methods

Add GlanceEnabledImportMethods parameter, and set the default value to
restrict Glance from using its 'glance-direct' import method. The
glance-direct method requires a special configuration when deployed in
an HA environment, and that capability will be added in a later release.

Closes-Bug: #1765439
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568366
Change-Id: I7038601d7505a60df2a1fb7fd8db818efa105341

subject: Allow setting client name on the Session
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-12 15:33:18.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/client-name-on-session-88fea1e9922f55d9.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/session.py'], 'message': 'Allow setting client name on the Session

Sometimes, you have a library, such a shade, that creates one Session
and a bunch of adapters on top of that - but it's still the same client.
Allowing setting the client_name and client_version on the Session as
defaults avoids having to do it on every adapter/call.

Also, it turns out that without setting it on the Session, the
client_name/client_version doens't get passed to keystone discovery
calls (because they're done transparently on the Session) so the call to
the version discovery document incorrectly reports

  "User-Agent: v.py/1 os-client-config/1.26.1 keystoneauth1/2.18.0
               python-requests/2.13.0 CPython/2.7.12"

when it should report

  "User-Agent: v.py/1 os-client-config/1.26.1 shade/1.19.1
               keystoneauth1/2.18.0 python-requests/2.13.0 CPython/2.7.12"

like the rest of the calls.

Change-Id: Id83f8baa0e905b814326f079fde7bef5dd8177fc
'}]
commit_message:
Allow setting client name on the Session

Sometimes, you have a library, such a shade, that creates one Session
and a bunch of adapters on top of that - but it's still the same client.
Allowing setting the client_name and client_version on the Session as
defaults avoids having to do it on every adapter/call.

Also, it turns out that without setting it on the Session, the
client_name/client_version doens't get passed to keystone discovery
calls (because they're done transparently on the Session) so the call to
the version discovery document incorrectly reports

  "User-Agent: v.py/1 os-client-config/1.26.1 keystoneauth1/2.18.0
               python-requests/2.13.0 CPython/2.7.12"

when it should report

  "User-Agent: v.py/1 os-client-config/1.26.1 shade/1.19.1
               keystoneauth1/2.18.0 python-requests/2.13.0 CPython/2.7.12"

like the rest of the calls.

Change-Id: Id83f8baa0e905b814326f079fde7bef5dd8177fc

subject: Added new logger to log request_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-03 06:09:25.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py'], 'message': "Added new logger to log request_id

Created a new logger instance 'request_id_logger’ which will be
used to log 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' for each API call only
when ‘keystoneauth.request-ids’ logger is set with logging
level ‘INFO’ and below.

Example of log message:

INFO keystoneauth.request_ids [None req-74cc49de-4316-469f-8a05-62a9f7cc53bc admin admin]
GET call to network for
http://10.232.48.200:9696/v2.0/security-groups?id=da5604ea-5d65-4c1a-bb12-9ee8d9fe104e
used request id req-f82663b4-38ae-46ec-a76d-50748dd38895

To use this feature, user must add ‘keystoneauth.request_ids=INFO’
to ’default_log_levels' config option of individual OpenStack
service config file.
For example in nova.conf, ‘default_log_levels' should
be set as below:

default_log_levels = […, ‘keystoneauth.request_ids=INFO’]

Also, changed the logging level from ‘debug’ to ‘info’ as
operator now can decide whether to log  request_ids or not
using newly added logger name.

Change-Id: I78f5f0109728c083a4b559c00c7322bfa6b77fae
"}]
commit_message:
Added new logger to log request_id

Created a new logger instance 'request_id_logger’ which will be
used to log 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' for each API call only
when ‘keystoneauth.request-ids’ logger is set with logging
level ‘INFO’ and below.

Example of log message:

INFO keystoneauth.request_ids [None req-74cc49de-4316-469f-8a05-62a9f7cc53bc admin admin]
GET call to network for
http://10.232.48.200:9696/v2.0/security-groups?id=da5604ea-5d65-4c1a-bb12-9ee8d9fe104e
used request id req-f82663b4-38ae-46ec-a76d-50748dd38895

To use this feature, user must add ‘keystoneauth.request_ids=INFO’
to ’default_log_levels' config option of individual OpenStack
service config file.
For example in nova.conf, ‘default_log_levels' should
be set as below:

default_log_levels = […, ‘keystoneauth.request_ids=INFO’]

Also, changed the logging level from ‘debug’ to ‘info’ as
operator now can decide whether to log  request_ids or not
using newly added logger name.

Change-Id: I78f5f0109728c083a4b559c00c7322bfa6b77fae

subject: Implement ReqContextManager for Session
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-12-01 20:43:59.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/RequestContextManager-8e7cf3f33aa45af9.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/req_context_manager.py'], 'message': 'Implement ReqContextManager for Session

Nodepool and Shade use a concept of a task manager to execute remote
actions. This allows for things like local rate limiting in a multi-
threaded TaskManager in nodepool, but a direct action passthrough
TaskManager in Ansible.

This change implements a Request Context Manager that the keystoneauth
Session utilizes to make all requests. The default implementation
is one that behaves the same as if no specialized code is added.
Additional logic can be executed explicitly prior-to, during the
request handling, and post-request handling stages via the standard
context_manager style interfaces.

Session now always encapsulates the request via the ReqContextManager
or the class that acts the same passed to the Session constructor.

Change-Id: I620f4e095228d4f0c6151ca70d030df86ae1b7c9
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement ReqContextManager for Session

Nodepool and Shade use a concept of a task manager to execute remote
actions. This allows for things like local rate limiting in a multi-
threaded TaskManager in nodepool, but a direct action passthrough
TaskManager in Ansible.

This change implements a Request Context Manager that the keystoneauth
Session utilizes to make all requests. The default implementation
is one that behaves the same as if no specialized code is added.
Additional logic can be executed explicitly prior-to, during the
request handling, and post-request handling stages via the standard
context_manager style interfaces.

Session now always encapsulates the request via the ReqContextManager
or the class that acts the same passed to the Session constructor.

Change-Id: I620f4e095228d4f0c6151ca70d030df86ae1b7c9
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Ceph: Chart import from OSH

The ceph chart imported from its state as of commit,
sha:4399e39a9cd7b7b878aaf137cefd39a0dff81a06

The Delta between PS1 and the current PS show the changes required
to support:
 * RBAC - though this currently grants ceph a cluster-admin role
 * Local Image Repo Use
 * Multiple namespace support for service dependency checks

Change-Id: I85a04bb39fe02f302df0441c4bb9f6cf454c67f4

commit_message:
WIP: ZuulV3 compatible deployment and Kubeadm-aio2

This PS provides a replacement for the original gate scripts, using
ansible and compatible with ZuulV3 native operation. It also moves
kubeadm-aio to a more robust solution for deployment of clusters.

Change-Id: Ic036d6f718eb83d6830354f63b2d0a3b023cc605

subject: Gate: Update CentOS and Fedora gates to use the LT Docker
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-09-26 18:28:50.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/funcs/kube.sh', 'tools/gate/funcs/common.sh'], 'message': 'Gate: Update CentOS and Fedora gates to use the LT Docker

This PS updates the gate script to use the current LT support version
of docker from the Distros repos. This has two effects:
1) moves to use docker 1.12.x inline with ubuntu
2) works round the tempory issue of k8s 1.7 defaulting to shared PID
namespaces with Docker >= 1.13 which causes issues for the rabbitmq
checks and also running systemd containers in pods.

Change-Id: I2e54733f7fd0e369f25b6dea5a5836bec754b036
'}]
commit_message:
Gate: Update CentOS and Fedora gates to use the LT Docker

This PS updates the gate script to use the current LT support version
of docker from the Distros repos. This has two effects:
1) moves to use docker 1.12.x inline with ubuntu
2) works round the tempory issue of k8s 1.7 defaulting to shared PID
namespaces with Docker >= 1.13 which causes issues for the rabbitmq
checks and also running systemd containers in pods.

Change-Id: I2e54733f7fd0e369f25b6dea5a5836bec754b036

commit_message:
Ceph: CephFS external provisioner and client helm tests

This PS adds CephFS support, proving a solution for charts requiring
`ReadWriteMany` PVs. It also adds `helm test` support for client
namespaces for both RBD and CephFS PV types.

Change-Id: Iaef890bcf651a1f963abbff82a63ffc49ff4e22c

commit_message:
RFC: Ingress VIP IP on edge nodes

This PS adds a VIP to edge nodes when running the ingress controller
in the Hosts Network NS. It is part of a larger effort to publish
services externally via ECMP IPs.

Please see: https://asciinema.org/a/bNnZS5Sc7iGjKKPOY7h7Emljq
And: https://openstack-lcoo.atlassian.net/browse/OSH-84

Change-Id: Ice3ec4865cd161da0464750ea4e0d8802d5a7c50

commit_message:
WIP: LOCI Image Support.

This PS provides LOCI image support. As LOCI images do not contain
any configuration once complete OpenStack-Helm should be entirely
image agnostic.

Change-Id: I62c738adaf3516cc3e12ff839a6c98c7525c0c26

commit_message:
Create Octavia policy roles and legacy admin-owner rules

Octavia has introduced new roles for more granular access policies.
This will create those keystone roles and if the legacy parameter
is set create admin or user rules which are similar what Neutron
allowed before.

Change-Id: I2d6b7278d7d4af2669cba7ac760dae0bc8e6f183

commit_message:
fix doc build

Apparently pip 10 dropped the options for allowing external and
insecure packages. We shouldn't need those anyway.

Remove the index pages within each series directory, since the specs are
linked using a glob pattern in the main table of contents. This removes
all of the "$series Release" entries from the main table of contents.

Add the rocky directory specs to the master toctree

Change-Id: Ic8714c42f31a98020dfb70e65e9b2d9240fcf41b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Currently, we delete ironic node resource provider inventory from placement
to indicate that the node is not available for deployment during the cleaning
process or when in maintenance. This is not actually required as we can

commit_message:
Allow having placement inventories with reserved value equal to total

Currently, we delete ironic node resource provider inventory from placement
to indicate that the node is not available for deployment during the cleaning
process or when in maintenance. This is not actually required as we can
reserve all the inventory, which describes more accurately what is going on,
and introduces issues like https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1771577.

APIImpact
blueprint: allow-reserved-equal-total-inventory
Change-Id: I0aec5e9f0a26430a9b104159c62ba1d07944ce9f

subject: Create DNS records when using DNS HA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-23 17:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'ocf/maas/maas_dns.py', 'tox.ini', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Create DNS records when using DNS HA

Deficiencies in the older maas API client that is used to manage
DNS records for DNS HA prevent DNS records being created. This
change creates the DNS records by directly interacting with the REST
maas api (v2). If the old approach of pre-creating the DNS records is
followed then those are used rather than creating new ones.

Change-Id: I6e1d7e5f0a7d813c78dfc1e78743ae7b218fbd01
Closes-Bug: 1764832
'}]
commit_message:
Create DNS records when using DNS HA

Deficiencies in the older maas API client that is used to manage
DNS records for DNS HA prevent DNS records being created. This
change creates the DNS records by directly interacting with the REST
maas api (v2). If the old approach of pre-creating the DNS records is
followed then those are used rather than creating new ones.

Change-Id: I6e1d7e5f0a7d813c78dfc1e78743ae7b218fbd01
Closes-Bug: 1764832

subject: Fix gate problems: Unittest and CentOS new kernel
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-16 09:57:11.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/db/test_maintenance.py', 'playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-release/post.yaml', 'zuul.d/legacy-networking-ovn-jobs.yaml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-release/run.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix gate problems: Unittest and CentOS new kernel

This patch is fixing two problems that are currently blocking the gate:

1. Unittests failure

The tests: test_get_deleted_resources_order and
test_get_inconsistent_resources_order were failing because the setUp()
method from its class was being invoked before the
SecurityGroupTestPlugin() was initialized.

That wasn't a problem before, but due to the commit
0c112a9f8997472bc9bc27b11501fc18c2e35dd5 in Neutron the "description"
field from the security groups API was removed in favor of the
standardattrdescription extension, therefor we needed that plugin to be
initialized before.

2. CentOS 7 new kernel version

There's some issue with the new kernel version (3.10.0-862) from CentOS7
which is causing the jobs to fail with an SSH timeout. The problem is
currently on investigation.

For now, let's switch the tempest-ovs-stable job back to ubuntu and
unblock the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1771336
Change-Id: Ia7cba29861bfd3991c81e4af36d8abcf29cac159
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate problems: Unittest and CentOS new kernel

This patch is fixing two problems that are currently blocking the gate:

1. Unittests failure

The tests: test_get_deleted_resources_order and
test_get_inconsistent_resources_order were failing because the setUp()
method from its class was being invoked before the
SecurityGroupTestPlugin() was initialized.

That wasn't a problem before, but due to the commit
0c112a9f8997472bc9bc27b11501fc18c2e35dd5 in Neutron the "description"
field from the security groups API was removed in favor of the
standardattrdescription extension, therefor we needed that plugin to be
initialized before.

2. CentOS 7 new kernel version

There's some issue with the new kernel version (3.10.0-862) from CentOS7
which is causing the jobs to fail with an SSH timeout. The problem is
currently on investigation.

For now, let's switch the tempest-ovs-stable job back to ubuntu and
unblock the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1771336
Change-Id: Ia7cba29861bfd3991c81e4af36d8abcf29cac159

subject: Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-05-11 08:18:12.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/schema/open_vswitch/commands.py'], 'message': "Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)

Right now the DbListCommand retrieves the uuid's of all the elements
passed in as argument. This is an O(n^2) operation so when the number
of elements in a grows it's likely that we get Timeout Exceptions.

Instead of doing this, whenever possible, we'll retrieve all the
elements (from the in-memory replica) and only fetch those who were
passed as arguments avoiding the O(n^2) operation.

NOTE: this cherry pick conflicted because in stable/pike, the commands.py
file was in different location.

Closes-Bug: #1769897
(cherry picked from fd64d41ea6f208a5752fbcd45952a04633ee1392)
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iacded885bb852315263ee926b9af5a1c3dc0dbba
"}]
commit_message:
Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)

Right now the DbListCommand retrieves the uuid's of all the elements
passed in as argument. This is an O(n^2) operation so when the number
of elements in a grows it's likely that we get Timeout Exceptions.

Instead of doing this, whenever possible, we'll retrieve all the
elements (from the in-memory replica) and only fetch those who were
passed as arguments avoiding the O(n^2) operation.

NOTE: this cherry pick conflicted because in stable/pike, the commands.py
file was in different location.

Closes-Bug: #1769897
(cherry picked from fd64d41ea6f208a5752fbcd45952a04633ee1392)
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iacded885bb852315263ee926b9af5a1c3dc0dbba

commit_message:
build: remove info that image squash support is disabled

We do not tell that optionX or optionY is disabled so why we have to
inform that image squash is disabled?

This is an option which has to be enabled and then informing that it is
enabled has sense.

Change-Id: I14b9b02e3cb290128d9f7673df8efe61aaa08c31

commit_message:

  test_list_tenants_returns_only_authorized_tenants and
  tempest.api.identity.v2.test_users.IdentityUsersTest.

that microversion might not be available on the cloud in question. Throw

commit_message:
Throw an error on missing support for default microversion

We've given the user the ability to set a default microversion. However,
that microversion might not be available on the cloud in question. Throw
an error in such cases.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568640
Change-Id: Ic600727a02fd3ba83e51a6a38ac784818c649c9b

commit_message:
Use openstack.config for arguments parsing

This change switches the CLI to use openstacksdk for populating
authentication arguments and creating a session. As a side effect,
using clouds.yaml is now supported and used in the CI.

commit_message:
Require wsgi-intercept 1.7.0

This is needed for the fix to this issue:

https://github.com/cdent/wsgi-intercept/issues/53

revisions:

Because we run fetch-images role twice (minimum) we don't need
to cache md5, it should be calculated in every case as new var.
Possibly second time it's not overriden and remains the cached

Related-Bug: #1770972

Change-Id: Idaddfd4f58d92ab0aeb47f7d7bfb04990867e394
"}]
commit_message:
Don't cache calculated md5 variables

Because we run fetch-images role twice (minimum) we don't need
to cache md5, it should be calculated in every case as new var.
Possibly second time it's not overriden and remains the cached
value.
Related-Bug: #1770972

Change-Id: Idaddfd4f58d92ab0aeb47f7d7bfb04990867e394

subject: [haproxy] Enable global optimization options
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-11 13:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': '[haproxy] Enable global optimization options

This patch enables 3 new configuration options for haproxy.cfg
global section.

  - haproxy_processes: number of haproxy processes (default:1).
  - haproxy_max_connections: number of concurrent connections (default:4000)
  - haproxy_process_cpu_map: enforces 1:1 mapping/affinity between
process and core. (default: no).

Closes-Bug: #1770060
Change-Id: I33fc499b083c7bcc548133498e44406a479389f1
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>
'}]
commit_message:
[haproxy] Enable global optimization options

This patch enables 3 new configuration options for haproxy.cfg
global section.

  - haproxy_processes: number of haproxy processes (default:1).
  - haproxy_max_connections: number of concurrent connections (default:4000)
  - haproxy_process_cpu_map: enforces 1:1 mapping/affinity between
process and core. (default: no).

Closes-Bug: #1770060
Change-Id: I33fc499b083c7bcc548133498e44406a479389f1
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Revert "libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks"

This change breaks block live migrations for raw images,
including the case of vfat config drive.

Closes-Bug: #1770640

This reverts commit 23bd8f62634707fc9896a38ff4dae606c89c6c4b.

subject: Use partial loading of workflow execution in the controller
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-15 11:57:59.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_executions.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlalchemy_db_api.py'], 'message': 'Use partial loading of workflow execution in the controller

* Added "fields" argument to db_api.get_workflow_execution() method
  so that we could load particular fields instead of the full object.
  In many cases we don't need all object fields.
* Used this argument in the REST API method that deletes a workflow
  execution because we only need the "state" field.

Change-Id: I36fd93d9869eec9428959e6848f8b441136c644e
'}]
commit_message:
Use partial loading of workflow execution in the controller

* Added "fields" argument to db_api.get_workflow_execution() method
  so that we could load particular fields instead of the full object.
  In many cases we don't need all object fields.
* Used this argument in the REST API method that deletes a workflow
  execution because we only need the "state" field.

Change-Id: I36fd93d9869eec9428959e6848f8b441136c644e

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-04-04 08:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['config/general_config/featureset051.yml'], 'message': 'Add featureset051 to test keystone-only upgrades

This featureset will be used to test the simplest possible upgrade.
This will deploy the overcloud with scenario000 which is only
keystone and the basic services to make keystone work. It will
then upgrade that overcloud to release N+1.

This featureset can be used to test that all of the CI code
surrounding upgrades is working as expected, and therefore will
be perfect for using in gate jobs for the various CI repos.

Change-Id: I1b3ecc8cc7c713594c1ae8a69aa1fd1d3d7e9dfd
'}]
commit_message:
Add featureset051 to test keystone-only upgrades

This featureset will be used to test the simplest possible upgrade.
This will deploy the overcloud with scenario000 which is only
keystone and the basic services to make keystone work. It will
then upgrade that overcloud to release N+1.

This featureset can be used to test that all of the CI code
surrounding upgrades is working as expected, and therefore will
be perfect for using in gate jobs for the various CI repos.

Change-Id: I1b3ecc8cc7c713594c1ae8a69aa1fd1d3d7e9dfd

subject: Be clear about python3: Remove its support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-07 14:24:16.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': 'Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: Icc5e35c75f83580b76addd2b21b7a4e56001228e
'}]
commit_message:
Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: Icc5e35c75f83580b76addd2b21b7a4e56001228e

Be clear about python3: Remove its support

We have never really tested python3 at large scale, and more and
more bugs are filed in stable branches due to dual stack.

We should stick to python2 in the stable branches, which is
what was tested in our gates.

Change-Id: I1514395e9d339352d9855f5641986f9b8f733104

commit_message:
py3: Fix ingress_bw_limit_for_dpdk_port() value conversion

Python 3 is not able to type int from string but max_bw_in_bytes is a
string in float format. This patch types first to float and then to int,
hence no ValueError is raised.

Change-Id: I7a527a58f79c1451d8593330d433f620cb0a4107
Closes-bug: #1771409

commit_message:
Fix the variable for identity version, change default

The names were used for the same entity, so the default was never
applied. Use the variable defined first (and whose name looks
more consistent with the variable normally used to defined
the identity name).

Also, change the default version to 3. As no one seems to be
using it right now on the gates, it should not break anything.

Change-Id: I4cbb104198e2cdaa8e3e8c4b1f1c20dc3e0048b5

subject: Clean up OpenShift DevStack directories on unstack
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'michal.dulko@gmail.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 14885, 'name': 'Daniel Mellado', 'email': 'dmellado@redhat.com', 'username': 'daniel-mellado'}, {'_account_id': 21041, 'name': 'Yossi Boaron', 'email': 'yossi.boaron.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'yboaron'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-04-25 14:19:31.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/lib/kuryr_kubernetes', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Clean up OpenShift DevStack directories on unstack

When doing a sequence of stack-unstack with DevStack configured to
deploy OpenShift it will leave over the data directory of OpenShift.
When stacking again openshift-node will reuse old configuration even if
$DATA_DIR is removed by the user. This causes it to use old certificates
and be unable to connect to the cluster.

This commit fixes it by cleaning up the directories we use:
* Placing all the configs in the $DATA_DIR. Before this commit
  openshift-node data landed in $DEST/openshfit.
* Moving OpenShift binaries directory from $DEST/openshift to
  $DATA_DIR/openshift/bin.
* Making sure $DATA_DIR/openshift is purged on unstacking.

Change-Id: Ia3bbf868b1a77c9afa22bebd779ec5dc646958ce
Closes-Bug: 1759242
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up OpenShift DevStack directories on unstack

When doing a sequence of stack-unstack with DevStack configured to
deploy OpenShift it will leave over the data directory of OpenShift.
When stacking again openshift-node will reuse old configuration even if
$DATA_DIR is removed by the user. This causes it to use old certificates
and be unable to connect to the cluster.

This commit fixes it by cleaning up the directories we use:
* Placing all the configs in the $DATA_DIR. Before this commit
  openshift-node data landed in $DEST/openshfit.
* Moving OpenShift binaries directory from $DEST/openshift to
  $DATA_DIR/openshift/bin.
* Making sure $DATA_DIR/openshift is purged on unstacking.

Change-Id: Ia3bbf868b1a77c9afa22bebd779ec5dc646958ce
Closes-Bug: 1759242

commit_message:

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

commit_message:
Support oslo.messaging services for separate RPC and Notification

This commit introduces oslo.messaging service variables in place of
the rabbitmq server. This will enable the use of separate and alternative
messaging system backends for RPC and Notify communications with
minimal impact to the overall deployment configuration.

This patch:
* update service passwords
* add oslo-messaging to group vars
* update inventory group vars for each service
* add common task for oslo messaging vhost/user install
* update service install playbooks

Change-Id: I235bd33a52df5451a62d2c8700a65a1bc093e4d6

subject: Fix libvirtd option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-15 19:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb', 'manifests/migration/libvirt.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_migration_libvirt_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix libvirtd option

Some old code for Ubuntu 14.04 was adding the -d flag to libvirtd in
Debian, leading to libvirtd not being able to restart. This fixes it by
simply removing the old code for Ubuntu 14.04 support, and leaving a
single case where we want only the -l flag to libvirtd.

Change-Id: I2b84881e7405794b2464945cad9a9be641a31af7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix libvirtd option

Some old code for Ubuntu 14.04 was adding the -d flag to libvirtd in
Debian, leading to libvirtd not being able to restart. This fixes it by
simply removing the old code for Ubuntu 14.04 support, and leaving a
single case where we want only the -l flag to libvirtd.

Change-Id: I2b84881e7405794b2464945cad9a9be641a31af7

commit_message:
Update repo_build test-vars data

This updates the repo_build data to the current
package list output from the py_pkgs lookup.

It also changes the implementation of how the
test data is stored and consumed to make it easier
to maintain in the future.

Some line spacing is also added to the test playbook
to make the tasks easier to distinguish.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568621
Change-Id: Icf102a78fd0cf9aae3c09378235f2d91f7db8cdd

commit_message:
Only allow for deleting completed executions

A force parameter was added in case deleting a running execution is
needed but that will spew all kinds of errors afterwards
The default is force = False

(backported from I19d822800a1ee056682daeaa7ddf0f400392525d)

Closes-bug: 1598135

Conflicts:
	mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py

Change-Id: I3706d5b5a3baee26a1902be5818887a38115c8f1

Add support for listing hosts in cellv2

in one or all v2 cells.

commit_message:
Include both new and deprecated rules in generated sample

Previously, if a deprecated_rule was set on a rule, only the
deprecated rule was written to the sample policy file.  This is
wrong since we want to be setting the new, undeprecated rule going
forward.

Change-Id: I181aeecda686d1d499616254c93002f51a5462c3

commit_message:
Remove LIBS_FROM_GIT as a var in zuul.yaml

As per latest changes in Zuul, there's no need to set LIBS_FROM_GIT
variable manually; instead, we can just specify the project in
`required-projects` and the devstack job will set it up  automatically.

Change-Id: Ib9f506b802f6af914d1d9b37017074dfdcf23d2c

commit_message:
Add INVENTORY_INUSE to DELETE /rp/{u}/inventories

Change I9a833aa35d474caa35e640bbad6c436a3b16ac5e added a custom error
code framework to the placement API and, as an example of a specific
error code, created INVENTORY_INUSE ('placement.inventory.inuse') for
PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories.  We have essentially the
same error condition for DELETE /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories,
so this change set adds the same error code there.

Change-Id: I52715205e607cef5deee1351099725885b282c08

commit_message:
Add four new actions to the Ceph charm

* list-host-osds - lists mounted OSDs for a given unit
* get-health - outputs ceph -s output
* disk-for-osd - returns the block device backing a given OSD
* osd-for-disk - returns the OSD ID (if any) for a given disk

Including unit tests for the above four actions.

Change-Id: Ic9f27d611c0be4f3056d1360d03f93d4d458ac14
Closes-Bug: #1720099

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-15 11:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/inventory.py', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/trait.py'], 'message': "placement: Fix HTTP error generation

The traits and the inventories wsgi handler inserted the detailed error
message to the webob.exc.HTTPXXX exceptions via the 'explanation' kwarg.
This caused that the generated error messages does not contain the generic
explanation of the HTTP error code just the passed in explanation text.
The rest of the placement API uses first positional arg of the exception
classes to pass in the extra details. Having this inconsistency makes
really hard to print proper error messages from the osc-placement
plugin.

This patch removes the incosistency by changing the code to use the
positional arg.

The change does not affect nova.scheduler.client.report._RE_INV_IN_USE
regex usage as that regex applied via re.search() and this change only
adds a new sentece to the message.

Change-Id: I196c2e3dabcbf0564c1ca0bd4870dc2df3efc836
Close-Bug: #1771325
"}]
commit_message:
placement: Fix HTTP error generation

The traits and the inventories wsgi handler inserted the detailed error
message to the webob.exc.HTTPXXX exceptions via the 'explanation' kwarg.
This caused that the generated error messages does not contain the generic
explanation of the HTTP error code just the passed in explanation text.
The rest of the placement API uses first positional arg of the exception
classes to pass in the extra details. Having this inconsistency makes
really hard to print proper error messages from the osc-placement
plugin.

This patch removes the incosistency by changing the code to use the
positional arg.

The change does not affect nova.scheduler.client.report._RE_INV_IN_USE
regex usage as that regex applied via re.search() and this change only
adds a new sentece to the message.

Change-Id: I196c2e3dabcbf0564c1ca0bd4870dc2df3efc836
Close-Bug: #1771325

commit_message:
Improve Mistral API DB error handling

Everywhere the DB API is used, errors related to DB connectivity,
deadlocks or similar operational errors can happen. In order to
compensate this, all DB API calls are surrounded by the same retry
logic that matches the REST requirements (reasonable response time,
service specific error message)

Change-Id: I24227e1a763114b9895ac8901b7096445b7df77f
(cherry picked from commit f0b51965664a51881c294e3455290ca9abd4054c)

commit_message:
Add 2.55 schema & update flavor API in flavors_client

Compute microversion 2.55 adds 'description' in
flavor APIs response and new API to update the same.

This commit fill the schema gap for that and also
add new updte flavor API in flavors_client lib.

Change-Id: I91c049c3aa9dab5a272369edd18f2c5890d1e5b0

commit_message:
Improve Mistral API DB error handling

Everywhere the DB API is used, errors related to DB connectivity,
deadlocks or similar operational errors can happen. In order to
compensate this, all DB API calls are surrounded by the same retry
logic that matches the REST requirements (reasonable response time,
service specific error message)

Change-Id: I24227e1a763114b9895ac8901b7096445b7df77f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-09 20:48:01.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/tripleo/test_tripleo_deploy.py'], 'message': "Error if deployment fails

During some of the recent refactoring, we lost tripleoclient returning
non-zero when the 'tripleo deploy' command fails. This patch adds a
check to the return code to ensure we throw an error if it failed.

Change-Id: I82144af35f5f9cd57ef794cc58c33b0ab15b02b2
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one
"}]
commit_message:
Error if deployment fails

During some of the recent refactoring, we lost tripleoclient returning
non-zero when the 'tripleo deploy' command fails. This patch adds a
check to the return code to ensure we throw an error if it failed.

Change-Id: I82144af35f5f9cd57ef794cc58c33b0ab15b02b2
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-16 02:11:17.000000000', 'files': ['masakariclient/sdk/ha/v1/_proxy.py', 'masakariclient/v1/client.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/v1/host.py', 'masakariclient/plugin.py', 'masakariclient/tests/unit/v1/test_client.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/v1/segment.py', 'masakariclient/osc/v1/host.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/__init__.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/v1/notification.py', 'requirements.txt', 'masakariclient/common/utils.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/__init__.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/v1/__init__.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/connection.py', 'masakariclient/sdk/ha/ha_service.py', 'masakariclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_host.py', 'masakariclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Remove masakariclient's proxy class

Change I9b2d140065390d94dda532c39777cf691775e21e has added masakari
commands to openstacksdk and those are available in openstacksdk
version 0.13.0. So the respective sdk resource proxy class implemented
in masakariclient is no longer required.

This patch fixes below:
- Removes the proxy class from masakariclient, and modifies to use the
  proxy class implemented in openstacksdk.
- Related bug: #1756047

Closes-Bug: #1756047
Change-Id: I5ecc4f8edc283e16cc7a1bd83a0a21735135199c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove masakariclient's proxy class

Change I9b2d140065390d94dda532c39777cf691775e21e has added masakari
commands to openstacksdk and those are available in openstacksdk
version 0.13.0. So the respective sdk resource proxy class implemented
in masakariclient is no longer required.

This patch fixes below:
- Removes the proxy class from masakariclient, and modifies to use the
  proxy class implemented in openstacksdk.
- Related bug: #1756047

Closes-Bug: #1756047

commit_message:
deploy-steps: switch to tripleo_role_name

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
This patch uses the new variable set in the inventory to use a specific
TripleO var: tripleo_role_name which is the TripleO role name and not
the Ansible role names, both things are very different.

Depends-On: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
Change-Id: Iecaf6f1b830e65be2f9e2e44431054fe46f9f565
Related-Bug: #1771171

commit_message:
Include 'tripleo_role_name' in the inventory

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
As a transition, include "tripleo_role_name" in the inventory and once
we're ready we'll remove our usage of "role_name", in a future patch.

Related-Bug: #1771171
Change-Id: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
Depends-On: Id52a9c6b40c2af0e1fb40476a50669b2e07d3541

commit_message:
Use tripleo_role_name instead of role_name

role_name is private in Ansible 2.2 and we were lucky that it worked
until 2.4 but now in 2.5 it conflicts with tripleo vars.
We need to stop using it as we rename it here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1771171

Change-Id: Id52a9c6b40c2af0e1fb40476a50669b2e07d3541
Related-Bug: #1771171

commit_message:
Adds Create Container Workflow

This patch adds a workflow to update the parameters in a given
deployment plan so the tripleo.plan.create_container action does
not need to be called directly.

Change-Id: I7144b927b02f162433acc9481a43950d2c77cd9b
Closes-Bug: #1759308

commit_message:
Install Octavia amphora image if Red Hat

For a one-click deployment, the Octavia amphora image must be present in
the undercloud node. Currently users need to ensure the image file
exists before overcloud deployment. For Red Hat-based deployments, the
image is provided by package octavia-amphora-image. Thus the package
should be installed for a better user experience leading to a truly
one-click deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1770117
Change-Id: I3ed8144b52ba528f449a4abe5c2106a5c61f9d61

commit_message:
Validate that there should not be XFS volumes with ftype=0

If  we have XFS partitions formatted with ftype=0,
the upgrades will fail because ftype=0 is incompatible
with the docker overlayfs driver.

Related-Bug: 1765121
Change-Id: I895fc83d148523c283664080b7b1bf75d53d9edb
(cherry picked from commit a5e63ee72531c85ee527ce721022fffce3cfcf75)
(cherry picked from commit d54ae2d1e21245f7033107e1bae327621f54f82f)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-15 22:03:25.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job for sphinx >1.7

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

Change-Id: I22bfaf4debdf96d902f2158e541cd5036ec1b1dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for sphinx >1.7

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

Change-Id: I22bfaf4debdf96d902f2158e541cd5036ec1b1dd

subject: Update prometheus service discovery for openstack-exporter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-15 19:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['prometheus/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Update prometheus service discovery for openstack-exporter

This updates the prometheus service discovery configuration
to define the openstack-exporter service discovery separate from
the other services. This allows for relabeling the instance label
for the openstack-exporter service, removing the potential for
multiple data series being returned by the single stat panels in
the Grafana dashboards for the openstack services. As the other
services perform as expected when exporter pods restart, they
remain configured the same as before.

Change-Id: Iad4c56d31fb553a9629f5a6fd1eac5464207add4
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update prometheus service discovery for openstack-exporter

This updates the prometheus service discovery configuration
to define the openstack-exporter service discovery separate from
the other services. This allows for relabeling the instance label
for the openstack-exporter service, removing the potential for
multiple data series being returned by the single stat panels in
the Grafana dashboards for the openstack services. As the other
services perform as expected when exporter pods restart, they
remain configured the same as before.

Change-Id: Iad4c56d31fb553a9629f5a6fd1eac5464207add4
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix HTTP500 error of changes-since on v2.0 API

The experimental job legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-api failed at the gate
always, because test_list_servers_by_changes_since_invalid_date touched
less validation part on the API.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I0284a83a92d39d211af6108ed6cae2d8fe19da8f
Close-Bug: #1770705

commit_message:
Make neutron-tempest-plugin-designate-scenario voting

As this job looks very stable since quite long time, we decided
on Neutron CI meeting to promote it to be voting in check queue.

Change-Id: Ibfd35f6a5ba37f62590a0208dc74c4cee7d23b0a

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume_transfer

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume transfer API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/os-volume-transfer
* POST  /v3/{project_id}/os-volume-transfer/{transfer_id}/accept

Modified existing unit test cases which were mistakenly passed
'transer_id' in request body which is supposed to pass in path.

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: Idcbfd37d49584ed6cb438cfdc0e7403504977525

commit_message:
Log backup_service.restore() exception

If _detach_device() fails, the original exception raised by
backup_service.restore() will not be logged. Adding a log
statement in the exception handler.

Change-Id: Ibbc096981e2648aa06311d197b25c9be98caf3d3
Closes-bug: #1769740

commit_message:
python3: Add experimental jobs for functional and fullstack

As part of community goal to have services working with Python 3.5, this
patch adds back the exeperimental Python 3.5 functional and fullstack jobs
that got lost somewhere during zuul v3 migration.

Change-Id: I24506b94f3f4e111b3968e57deb683e9c874941c

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c
Change-Id: I20d45db6925f7534837e8d00d4d78f06b7c9897d

commit_message:
[Newton Only] Fix getting live value of nova/neutron during update.

In Ieb92ff161d1684c214382c5eb6b5949efc3fe75c we collect the current
value of neutron and nova host parameter.

It appears that we introduced a syntactic bug that was undetected
in the test environment.

This fixes those issues.

Change-Id: I06abb6e0a872319ef958b40ad32384928fa2bc9d
Resolve-Bug: #1771324

commit_message:
Call L3 checks before/after Role upgrade.

It worth calling L3-agent checks before and after each role
is upgrade.
This helps to narrow down when the packet loss or L3 failover
occurs.

Change-Id: I058d0171266c21f9ec398018095fd73d8597b745
(cherry picked from commit 5ca79c26ada5cc503df939b53c8dd5f7ffc4cbe8)

commit_message:
Prepare call, add --modify-role and --modify-vars

This allows the prepare command to set modify_role and modify_vars in
the call to container_images_prepare. The result will be an images
file that has extra options set in every entry.

The actual modification on the images is done during the upload
command, driven by these extra options.

Change-Id: Ia1dc7a1b7f777ac3e000f0c2e155be6330c05a2c
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Depends-On: I2c877a96264b351b4fc8527a3e40b87ddcb4f9a5

commit_message:
Update resource tree for elasticsearch/kibana

This adds the entry for resources for the apache proxy running in
the elasticsearch client and kibana pods. This also fixes an
incorrect enabled flag for resources in the kibana chart

Change-Id: Ifcd33a680167d7debfae2c4d71bdcb693632fce9

commit_message:
Persist package update ansible logs

We need to store the ansible playbook logs into persistent location.
We do it by ANSIBLE_LOG_PATH: /var/lib/mistral/package_update.log

Change-Id: I522acab84833b942865dc57156f3de99779d4f43
Resolves: rhbz#1572827

subject: Implement image customization during upload
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-08 20:38:45.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/image/kolla_builder.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/image/test_kolla_builder.py'], 'message': 'Implement image customization during upload

This allows an ansible role to be invoked after the image pull and
before the image push during an upload operation.

This mechanism can be used to modify images for tasks such:
- updating to latest packages during a CI run
- modifying an image to add a vendor plugin

Change-Id: I2c877a96264b351b4fc8527a3e40b87ddcb4f9a5

commit_message:
Implement image customization during upload

This allows an ansible role to be invoked after the image pull and
before the image push during an upload operation.

This mechanism can be used to modify images for tasks such:
- updating to latest packages during a CI run
- modifying an image to add a vendor plugin
- adding local developer code to an image to test deployment

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

Change-Id: I2c877a96264b351b4fc8527a3e40b87ddcb4f9a5
